processes.label: NYS Budget Process
processes.description: New York State's annual budget process, including state aid to NYC, MTA funding, and education funding.

steps.title: Agency Requests
steps.description: State agencies submit funding requests to Division of Budget.

steps.title: Executive Budget
steps.description: Governor releases Executive Budget proposal (by January 15).

steps.title: Legislative Hearings
steps.description: Assembly and Senate hold budget hearings; NYC officials testify on city needs.

steps.title: One-House Budget Bills
steps.description: Assembly and Senate each pass their own budget proposals.

steps.title: Three-Way Negotiation
steps.description: Governor, Assembly Speaker, and Senate Majority Leader negotiate final budget.

steps.title: Budget Adoption
steps.description: Legislature passes final budget bills; Governor signs (by April 1 deadline).

steps.title: Comptroller Oversight
steps.description: State Comptroller monitors spending compliance.

processes.label: Judicial Appointment (Court of Appeals)
processes.description: Process for selecting and confirming New York's highest court judges.

steps.title: Nomination Pool
steps.description: Commission submits list of qualified candidates to Governor.

steps.title: Governor Selection
steps.description: Governor selects one nominee from the list.

steps.title: Senate Confirmation
steps.description: Senate confirms or rejects nominee.

steps.title: Appointment
steps.description: Confirmed nominee takes office as Judge of the Court of Appeals.

processes.label: State Bond Act / Ballot Proposition
processes.description: Process for proposing and approving large state borrowing measures.

steps.title: Legislative Proposal
steps.description: Legislature passes bond act bill.

steps.title: Executive Review
steps.description: Governor approves; Attorney General reviews ballot language.

steps.title: Voter Referendum
steps.description: Voters approve or reject bond act at general election.

steps.title: Implementation
steps.description: State issues bonds and allocates funds to approved projects.

processes.label: Home Rule Request
processes.description: Process for NYC to request state legislation enabling local powers beyond current charter authority.

steps.title: Home Rule Request
steps.description: City Council passes resolution requesting state enabling legislation.

steps.title: Mayoral Approval
steps.description: Mayor signs home rule request and transmits to State Legislature.

steps.title: Legislative Sponsorship
steps.description: State legislators sponsor enabling bill in Assembly and Senate.

steps.title: State Legislative Passage
steps.description: Both houses pass enabling legislation.

steps.title: Gubernatorial Approval
steps.description: Governor signs bill into law, granting NYC requested authority.

processes.label: Mayoral Control of Schools Renewal
processes.description: Periodic state legislative process to renew or modify Mayor's authority over NYC Department of Education.

steps.title: Approaching Expiration
steps.description: Mayoral control authority approaches statutory expiration date.

steps.title: Renewal Proposal
steps.description: Governor proposes extension legislation; Mayor advocates for renewal.

steps.title: Legislative Debate
steps.description: State Assembly and Senate hold hearings and debate renewal terms.

steps.title: Legislative Passage
steps.description: Both houses pass renewal legislation, often with modifications to oversight.

steps.title: Gubernatorial Approval
steps.description: Governor signs bill, extending mayoral control for specified period.

processes.label: State Agency Rulemaking (SAPA)
processes.description: How NYS agencies create regulations under the State Administrative Procedure Act.

steps.title: Draft Proposed Rule
steps.description: State agency drafts proposed regulation.

steps.title: Public Notice
steps.description: Notice of Proposed Rulemaking published in State Register with 45-60 day comment period.

steps.title: Public Comment & Hearings
steps.description: Public submits comments; agency may hold hearings.

steps.title: Regulatory Impact Statement
steps.description: Agency prepares impact analysis; Governor's office may review.

steps.title: Final Adoption
steps.description: Agency adopts final rule; published in State Register and compiled in NYCRR.
